text.div:
Employment Status (ODH)

A value set consisting of codes pertaining to a person’s current economic relationship to a job. Employment status refers to whether a person is currently working for compensation, is unemployed (i.e., searching for work for compensation), or is not in the labor force (e.g. disabled, homemaker, chooses not to work, etc.). Employment status is not the same as classification of work.

This value set includes codes from the following code systems:

  • Import all the codes that are contained in https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewValueSet.action?oid=2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.7129

name: Employment Status (ODH)
